Posts.Content: Kargiro wrote: I had follow up mammo n u/s after 1.1cm enhancement on breast mri yesterday . The area in question is very deep and would not show up on mamm and u/s, the dr said she wasn't concerned and to follow up mri in 6 month to see if it grows. I'm concerned with this plan because why would you make this decision based on a less sensitive test knowing the area is too deep to capture an image any other way. That doesn't mean it's not there. I plan to ask primary doc about mri assisted biopsy. I have very dense breasts and don't want a scarier situation in 6 months. Thoughts, experiences? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Enhancement on MRI but not seen on mammo or u/s Kargiro MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Kargiro wrote: I was having pain in left breast for a few months, dr scheduled diagnostic mammo with u/s. Did mammo on both breasts but u/s the one with pain. Dr said debris in milk ducts- probably papillomas. Scheduled contrast MRI on both breasts. Results said both breast have multiple benign cysts, HOWEVER MRI showed an 11mm (1.1cm) suspicious "area". Have to wait a week to get diagnostic mammo and u/s on right breast. If MRI is so sensitive to say the cysts are benign, what am I to think about this area? I hate waiting, let's plan an attack and get on with it. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: No idea what to think at this point Kargiro Kargiro

Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2014 01:04AM Kargiro wrote: So, when dr office called the other day with mri results and a scheduled second look u/s I was in a deep sleep and scribbled what they told me. I just looked at it again and under the 11mm were the letters T1. Everything I searched re T1 means cancer. Is that what that means? They just read off words assuming I knew what they meant. What does that mean??!!
Posts.Title: No idea what to think at this point Kargiro Kargiro
